definitions.definition: : Having favorable rapport with a powerful entity.
Involved with organized crime, specifically someone not (yet) working for a crime organization, but referred to as a "friend" by made guys / wise guys inside the organization.
That cannot be partitioned into two nonempty open sets .
definitions.label_groups: mathematics , topology , of a topological space

definitions.definition: Having a path , either directed or undirected , connecting every pair of vertices .
examples: In a connected graph, there is no section (proper subset that includes all edges from each vertex in said subset) of the graph that is isolated from the rest.
definitions.label_groups: mathematics , graph theory , of a graph

definitions.definition: Having or supporting connections, especially when through technology such as networking software or a transportation network.

main_definition: (usually with " well -"): Having favorable rapport with a powerful entity.
secondary_definitions: ( Canada , US ) Involved with organized crime, specifically someone not (yet) working for a crime organization, but referred to as a "friend" by made guys / wise guys inside the organization.
( mathematics , topology , of a topological space ) That cannot be partitioned into two nonempty open sets .
( mathematics , graph theory , of a graph ) Having a path , either directed or undirected , connecting every pair of vertices .
Having or supporting connections, especially when through technology such as networking software or a transportation network.
